job_title: Care Manager in Fort Atkinson, WI
pros: I really enjoy working for My Choice WI. I have an incredibly supportive supervisor, with the other supervisors ready to lend a hand whenever it is needed. There is great flexibility to schedule your meetings how they work with your schedule. The job is different each day but I never feel alone with problems. I know how to do my job with no micro managing. You are set up for success with all the support there is with the company. There are also many options to move up or within the company, depending on your passions.
cons: The dental plan offered is not as good as other companies I have worked for, but that is nothing against the company as a whole. Sometimes you have to drive far, if a member moves but that is not a regular event

job_title: RN Case Manager in Pewaukee, WI
pros: Excellent Manager support. Excellent work life balance.
cons: Takes more than 40 hours weekly to complete workload.

review_title: Run as fast as you can! Recently ran😀
job_title: RN Case Manager in Madison, WI
pros: You can work from home…. Kind of. The supervisors are inexperienced for program. Unprofessional! They micromanage to the point of insanity. Everyone walks out. Many nurses with health issues due to stress.
cons: Members angry and leave because care teams cannot get them what is needed. They are so busy making new papers to complete that all of the care is gone. Not sure who is writing the reviews but we all feel the same. There is not work/life balance at all. Drove My Choice into the ground in 2 years! The young ladies in charge lie so they cover up what they do not do. Many of the young supervisors don’t have a clue and are lazy.

pros: Flexible schedule: typical hours are 8am - 4:30pm but can be flexed based on preference, emergencies that come up, appointments, etc. Appreciation: if a team or employee does a great job, it is actually recognized. This is true within teams, from leadership, and from other departments. Supervisors of the praised staff member are also looped in often so they're aware of these successes. Training opportunities: our HR team has a variety of professional growth trainings offered frequently. Leadership is also very supportive with growth into new roles. Room to grow/move within the organization: 30% of hires are internal transfers and promotions. Innovation: ability to use previous skills and knowledge to provide input, better processes, and participate in special projects. You are making a difference on a daily basis no matter what role you're in!
cons: Due to the office locations spread all throughout the state, you don't get to work physically close to a lot of other teams. Teams and Zoom has helped this quite a bit. Due to the nature of the industry, things change quickly. This would be a con for those who like a straight-forward schedule and set of tasks. It is fun for those of us that like a challenge and to problem-solve!

job_title: Utilization Review Nurse in Madison, WI
pros: Work from home, flexible schedule
cons: Significant culture change since growth

pros: Some of the best reasons to work for My Choice Wisconsin is the overall great feeling of helping someone in the community. I also enjoy the flexibility and being able to work from home. It is nice to be able to go to the office to print and gather additional resources as needed. My supervisors are extremely helpful and knowledgeable, understanding, caring, and family-oriented!
cons: Some of the downsides of working with My Choice Wisconsin is that in the beginning, it seems like a tremendous amount of paperwork. However, there are supportive staff to assist and also you work with another employee to get the work completed i.e. (Care Manager and a Registered Nurse). At times it may be difficult to reach a member and this may warrant a home visit at a short notice. The positive side to all of this is after years of working with My Choice, managing the paperwork gets easier because now you have a good understanding and good foundation of how to get the job done!

pros: Company offers flexibility. Decent culture. Peers are supportive.
cons: Constant changes, it's hard to keep up with current expectations. Once you learn one way to do something, it seems it changes. Peers and management are supportive through this - but it can be a bit much. Not all changes are company based, many are from DHS. Role requires you to "wear a lot of hats" and don't feel compensation reflects this accurately when those who work in one single department get paid the same and in some cases more, and they only have to be the "expert" in that one area.

job_title: RN Care Manager in La Crosse, WI
pros: Team focused approach to assist people within the community to reach their health and safety goals. Plenty of opportunities within the organization for growth, great pay and great benefits. Ample opportunities to have your voice heard for change, both within the organization and the community. You create your own schedule in regards to seeing Members in the community and working from home.
cons: The main con in the position is the lack of staffing within the community agencies that support our Members. The pro to this is being able to use unique and creative problem solving skills to get our Members the support that they need.

job_title: Care Manager in La Crosse, WI
pros: -work from home -flexible schedule -able to help those in need -good teammates -PTO is both easy and encouraged to use -work load is manageable most days
cons: -workload at times can be difficult (dependent on member issues) -changing policy/procedures can be difficult to track -pay is adequate, but not great -system does not offer all our members need (this is more of a society issue, not specific to My Choice), but it can be frustrating to work within the system we have

review_title: Great company to work for as a nurse who enjoys flexibility.
job_title: RN CM in Fort Atkinson, WI
pros: I control my schedule, working remotely is a plus. Working with a great team and Lead Supervisor who listens to my questions or concerns. Meeting member's in their homes and helping them live full lives.
cons: Time management for multiple tasks, need to be organized for this role.

review_title: Flexibility is what keeps employees here
job_title: RN Case Manager in Madison, WI
pros: Flexibility for sure, no weekend/holidays, can Flex Time IF you can manage to keep up with the workload. Good co-workers, the reason ppl stay is the remote work and flexibility
cons: Upper mgmt is a joke, don’t listen to or advocate for employees. Benefits suck and are expensive.

job_title: Care Manager in Oak Creek, WI
pros: I have been working with My Choice for over a year and love the flexibility and being able to create your own schedule around your members! My teammates and co-workers are always helpful and responsive, and I appreciated the guidance they have given me over this past year I really have gained much professional development in the social work field in which I can utilize in my career ahead.
cons: Large company with many departments and sometimes it is unclear with whom to reach out to in regard to member and vendor needs.

review_title: Review of work culture at My Choice WI
pros: Sense of community. Over my 5 years within this organization I feel like I have been able to build relationships amongst different departments. Whether it be through email communication, phone calls, in person meetings or trainings, or simply passing by in the office. Flexibility is a huge pro with this job. If you hold yourself accountable and complete your work, your leaders allow you to flex your schedule around to make personal appointments, etc. Sense of satisfaction. Helping others is not easy, but it is an honor to do so in a profession. This job gives me that sense of joy at the end of the day that we are able to help others in our local community. Ongoing education. I strive to learn. This job brings you into a variety of different situations with working with other organizations in the state. Communication with hospitals, day programs, group homes, DHS, APS, the list is endless. It is cool to see everything connect. Ability to move around in the company is a big one. There are many opportunities within the organization.
cons: I personally like to focus on the positives. One con may be moving around a lot. Family care is a revolving door of change. I try to tell myself change is always for the better, but it can be uncomfortable. Additionally, as the company grows, more personalities come into the mix. It can be hard to make your voice heard but I have seen this been achieved. The more you standout in your work, the more you get recognized, and the more say you obtain.

pros: I have been employed by this organization for about three years. So far it has been a great experience. They offer great work/life balance and treat their employees as professionals and with respect. There is good communication in our professional group and a general sense of support along with competitive salaries.
cons: For an NP who wants more patient contact or a clinic like setting this would not be an ideal job for you. There is a lot of chart review and reconciliation involved with this position.

review_title: Great teams, meaningful work (but a lot of it)
pros: Thorough training Great coworkers Supportive supervisors Plenty of specialized support teams Room for growth Hybrid field/WFH with flexibility
cons: Heavy case load Uncertainty with upcoming corporate acquisition

pros: Good coworker. A good place to learn.
cons: Not enough people to help with work

pros: Everyone I work with, and have contact within the organization are positive, engaging and supportive. I enjoy the diversity of my client/member base, and each have their own unique challenges. I am able to split my time between the office, home, and residential visits with no difficulty.
cons: There will be situations in which we are unable to assist our members as completely as we would like, due to circumstances we do not control.

pros: I have enjoyed my time with My Choice. Everyone here is super helpful and welcoming! My coworkers are fantastic - kind, welcoming, and smart - the kind of people you want by your side when things get difficult.
cons: It seems like not everyone has the same experience that I have had, however I think keeping a positive attitude is key. Things can be hard, as with everywhere, but the organization has great leaders.

job_title: Geriatric Nurse Practitioner in Madison, WI
pros: I have been working here almost 4 years and find it to be an excellent place to work. It is a very positive work culture, flexible and the work is very rewarding. Collaboration with other colleagues and departments is helpful and respectful.
cons: There have been some technology issues but the IT staff has been very helpful and responsive.

pros: Rewarding work caring for a population that needs it the most - makes you feel good about what you do and the positive impact you have on your community.
cons: There is a lot of documentation required, which is par for the course in any health care job.

job_title: Care Manager in Fort Atkinson, WI
pros: I have had a great experience working at MCW so far, and I do not see myself leaving any time soon. All team members have been great to work with and are friendly. Good benefits and flexibility. Everyday is different.
cons: I do not have any at the moment

pros: Great work life balance Teamwork Lots of support from management
cons: Cons are the same for starting any new job, not knowing anyone, getting use to their technology, paperwork, way of doing things.

pros: -Benefits -PTO -Rewarding work -Compensation -Mostly remote -Great support from supervisor and program management -Stability
cons: Nothing. I really love my job!

job_title: RN Care Manager in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Great pay No weekends or holidays
cons: Lots of travel Overtime Workload

pros: Freedom free do it yourself
cons: Idk people randomly fired seems like

pros: My Choice Wisconsin has taken many steps in the last few years to grow in serving and providing quality care to a wide population of Wisconsin's citizens. As such, there are many opportunities here to grow, learn, and to contribute to the organization's mission. The work is challenging and rewarding, and new ideas are always welcome. If you're interested in long-term care or health plans, this is a great place to learn and gain skills. There are many strong leaders here to learn from, and many of these individuals are "homegrown" in that they 've been with the organization for years and honed their leadership skills here. All in all, a great place to work!
cons: I would say as an organization, we are still fine-tuning our use of Zoom, Teams, etc. for remote work and ensuring that all individuals on the call are engaged.

job_title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) in Madison, WI
pros: I have really enjoyed getting to know my co-workers and I've enjoyed working within a team environment. The pay is good and management is receptive to employee ideas and concerns that may arise. Everyone I've had contact with has been friendly and welcoming. I moved from out of state around the end of 2019 and I love this company and I'm excited to see what's next in my future here.
cons: I feel that the main con from my personal view is not with the company. I feel the pandemic put a damper on being able to work in-person. I enjoy socializing with my co-workers and I enjoy being able to see them in-person. I'm looking forward for more socialization and the possibility of group activities.

job_title: Care Manager in Eau Claire, WI
pros: Work remotely, being able to see clients in community.
cons: Micro managed, extremely high case loads, unrealistic expectations.

pros:
- Exciting opportunity; rewarding work.
- Ability to interact with many departments and increase both knowledge & skills base.
cons:
- Management is inept; mid-level leadership was unprofessional and vindictive, in my experience. 
- Advancement is absolutely NOT encouraged nor supported, even parallel moves. Employees are very much boxed into the role they are hired for.

job_title: RN Care Manager in West Bend, WI
pros: I value working remotely as I am able to go for a walk when the sun is shining and not being limited to just going for a walk at noon. I love the hours Mon-Fri 8-4:30. The salary is good, my supervisors and co-workers are awesome, they are always willing to help others.
cons: The health insurance is not very good, it costs a lot and doesn't cover much. I don't enjoy being on call for one week per year. Many of my co-workers don't mind and volunteer for extra weeks but each care manager is still required to cover one week on call.

job_title: Regional Program Manager in West Bend, WI
pros:
I am proud to work for My Choice Wisconsin because of our dedication to service, equity, and respect. I come to work every day feeling like I'm making a difference in the lives of our members and our communities.
I work with an incredible group of individuals who are committed to our members, as well as the organization and team. Even on tough days, it's reassuring to see how much we support one another through teamwork and collaboration. I've truly never experienced this level of support, respect, and teamwork anywhere else.
cons: As with any healthcare profession, there have been some challenges related to the pandemic and caregiver shortage. However, I have been very impressed with the collaborative efforts occurring between internal departments to develop creative solutions to these barriers.

job_title: Member Rights Specialist in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Flexibility, work from home during pandemic
cons: Staff often unheard, poor benefits

review_title: New Employee. The jury is still out.
pros: Home based office, flexible schedule
cons: Majority of training is in office and through on demand modules which can get overwhelming to a new hire.

job_title: Customer Service Manager in Madison, WI
pros:
A organization doing important work- every role matters!
Supportive coworkers and management
Pay and benefits are reasonable
Welcoming environment
cons: It’s more a reality than a con, but you need to be adaptable and comfortable with change. It’s the nature of the business. If you looking for a position to set it and forget it, MCW may not be the right fit.

job_title: Regional Program Manager in La Crosse, WI
pros: From day one it was evident to me that My Choice Wisconsin was a corporation that I wanted to be part of. The senior leadership team really encourages a servant leadership type environment.
cons: This type of work takes a person with empathy and empathetic people can get drained easily. Self care is a must.

pros:
Work from home.
Strong support locally
cons:
Too high of caseload.
Too many hoops with upper management.

pros: The job pays well but they do micro manage their employees
cons: Micro managing is hard for the company culture.

job_title: Care Manager in La Crosse, WI
pros:
- flexible
- great support from leadership team
- good pay
- plenty of opportunities for career growth
cons: - disagreements between departments at times

job_title: Provider Relations Representative in Wauwatosa, WI
pros: My Choice Wisconsin is a recently merged company of My Choice Family Care, Care Wisconsin and Trilogy Medicaid.  The pay is competitive to others in the market and is on the higher side to some others out there.  My direct manager was very supportive and provided help when available which was limited due to having to support many new individuals on the team.  The coworkers here are great and were supportive when needing help.  The location is good as well.
cons: The company recently has gone through a few mergers and as a result there has been some unclear processes since things are changing.  Lots of turnover as well between all departments.  I would have to say their hr rules and processes are cold and are archaic.  You are required to provide a 30 day notice if you’re salary to be considered leaving in good standing or as rehire able.  If you’ve been at the organization for less than a year you lose any pto left.  To be honest it felt as if they try and hold staff hostage with their rules since they know there is mass turnover all over the organization.  They also are very unprofessional with not notifying you on things that could impact you last minute.  I received word from others that this is not a first and as such I would stay away.  Management with the merger is being pulled in many different directions and are not adequately supported.

job_title: RN Care Manager in Madison, WI
pros: Flexible schedule, no holidays or weekends.
cons: Insurance is not the best.

review_title: Weak Leadership support and extremely large caseloads
job_title: RN Care Manager in La Crosse, WI
pros: Remote work available, and pleasant people to work with
cons:
No overtime pay with expectation to work excessive overtime to keep up with oversized caseloads.
Chaotic caseload assignments
Oversized caseload assignments
Poor management assistance with complex coordination of member benefits

job_title: Provider Relations and Network Specialist in Madison, WI
pros: Working remotely was a huge bonus; the pay is decent
cons: the training could have been better; the pay is not commensurate with the amount of stress; slow to hire help (if they do it at all)

review_title: Low pay for a lot of responsibility
pros: Coworkers are the best part about the job
cons: Low pay for high demand

pros: Flexible, work from home, support
cons: At the time offered terrible computers and no cell phone, had to utilize phone service through computer, however, I think as I was leaving they implemented cell phones for case managers. Caseload went from 0 to 30 far too fast.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in La Crosse, WI
pros: I enjoy working for the company. My boss is great, as well as my coworkers. I feel like I get paid fairly for my work, and I the bonuses given are nice.
cons: I wish I could work more remote

pros: Flexibility, fair pay in comparison to other social service jobs, working with members is great
cons: Very high caseloads make it difficult to ensure the health and safety of all members. You tend to feel like you're advocating for the company and not the members. Poor health benefits.

pros:
- Co-workers are very nice and do a lot to help you get accommodated
- Members can be a genuine pleasure to work with
cons:
- Severely underpaid for the caseload
- Lots of pressure to get work done, which can create a dissonance between trying to help people while also meeting your deadlines
- It can feel like you're the only one who actually cares about your members, while the higher ups make policies that directly interfere with your work

review_title: A challenging, fast-paced, and exciting environment!
pros:
My job is always challenging me to be the best!
There is a lot of variety every day and things never have time to get boring. 
I am always learning and in turn, can help teach others on my team the things that i know.
The people I work with are THE BEST! We collaborate well and enjoy working together.
I have an extremely supportive boss who helps me grow professionally and personally.
The work can be demanding but it's also fun and I work with wonderful people.
My hours are flexible and it works with my family life.
cons: I wish that my insurance would completely pay for my child's braces, but alas, I realize that most insurances don't!

review_title: Awesome growth opportunities, work-life balance, and benefits!
pros: Work-life balance, growth opportunities within your current role and the company overall, acknowledgement for wins, flexibility of working from home/in office (depending on role), awesome benefits, knowing your day to day work is positively impacting the lives of others.
cons: We are spread across the state, so at times it would be nice to work with teams more directly on-site.

review_title: Fun and Dynamic Place to work
pros: I really enjoy working at My Choice Wisconsin. I have been here for almost four years. I really love the mission of supporting people with Disabilities and the frail elder population the the variety of Programs we provide throughout Wisconsin. What I love the most is working with an incredibly passionate team of Care Managers and Nurses. I am in awe of their dedication to serving our Members. I am extremely proud of the way we had to come together as an organization to figure out how to effectively do our mission during the COVID 19 Pandemic. I also enjoy the fast pace and autonomous work environment. Every day is different, and I enjoy being challenged
cons: Communication can improve, but I think it is the nature of the fast pace world we work.

pros: Able to construct your own work day and decide your schedule.
cons: Management who are not helpful. Excessively high case loads. Lack of support when working with difficult clients. Community not understanding the role of the care manager and facilities being annoyed by IDT monitoring clients.

review_title: This company does great things, but there are major issues with the hierarchy right now
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Milwaukee, WI
pros:
-very flexible work schedule
-9-5 job, M-F with no on call
-mostly remote
-home visits
-RN position has a lot of involvement in making decisions and care planning
-same caseload = you get to really know your patients and their families
cons:
-recent merger has caused many internal structure issues, minimal supervision, and decreased responsiveness from leadership
-caseloads have increased to 80 patients per RN
-policies don't always accommodate for the patient's best interest but are in place to save money for the company
- Charting system is tedious and unreliable
-significant repetition with the job tasks make it difficult to learn new things or grow
- high turnover = always training new employees and decreased continuity of care for patients
- Little to no opportunities for learning, growth, or career advancement
-No significant coverage for RNs when they are sick or on vacation; RNs come back to any work on their caseload that was missed while they were out
-No MAs or CNAs available to assist RNs

pros: Leadership Culture Mission Values Peers
cons: No bonus structure in place

pros:
At the time they had good health insurance. From what I hear, that is no longer offered.
Can't come.up with any more pros
cons:
Very toxic
Low pay
No work life balance 
No growth
Punitive
Everything is about money
Members don't matter 
Numbers and cuts is all that matters

pros: Organized corporate environment with clearly documented job duties
cons: Neglectful training leaving new staff floundering to figure out their role and how to execute tasks for job duties

job_title: Provider Services Specialist in Madison, WI
pros: It is a non-profit organization.
cons:
Many systems and processes have been made more inefficient.
Organizational culture post-merger has been weak.

job_title: Care Manager in Mount Pleasant, WI
pros: The coworkers are the most supportive group of people you could ever hope to work with. The leadership is also very communicative and helpful.
cons: The workload is intense at times and having a strong sense of time management and organization goes a long way.

pros: Autonomy and the ability to make your schedule fit what you need it to be.
cons: Work load and case load can be overwhelming

review_title: Run as fast as you can
job_title: RN Case Manger-2 in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Company does supply adequate training, but falls far short of what one really needs. Have to be on top of your game.
cons: Many home visits are in bug infested residences, condemned properties or drug and crime ridden areas of Milwaukee. Pay is on low end of scale, mileage and office supply is not what they promise. Support is not there, supervisors state they understand but dont change anything.

review_title: Company does not care about the health of their employees
pros: Pay, which was transitioned from Care Wisconsin, was good. After My Choice became involved, pay was lower as you are expected to put in many more than 40 hours per week.
cons: The work environment changed when the two organizations merged. My Choice does not care about employees mental or physical health and expect an unreasonable amount of work out from their Care Managers. In turn, this makes it very difficult to provide good Care Management to those they serve. Most people very unhappy there.

pros: My employment with My Choice Wisconsin has been a wonderful experience. My colleagues and supervisor include me in planning conversations, seek and value my input and give me the guidance and independence to be successful in my role.
cons: In a busy organization, communication can sometimes be difficult. But, I've learned that if I reach out or remind others to follow up, I play a vital role in helping our organization collectively communicate and achieve goals.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Beaver Dam, WI
pros: Management is always open to feedback and constructive criticism. Employees are treated very well, especially with everything that’s been going on in the world this past year. Schedules have become more flexible, everyone’s been given the option to work from home, managers have gone out of their way to maintain a positive and optimistic attitude during work hours.
cons: Communication isn’t what it should be, especially regarding patient care plan updates.

pros: Benefits, experience, clients, hours, flexible
cons: Constant changes, lots of paperwork.

pros: flexible, supportive co-workers, work from home,
cons: unorganized, poor company communication, not working up to level of license

job_title: Chief Executive Officer in Eau Claire, WI
pros: When you work with the same group of people for a few years they start to grow on you. I’m not ashamed to say that the My Choice staff have become like family to me. We’ve been there for one another through thick and thin. Plus, the work itself is incredibly rewarding though it can have its taxing moments.
cons: Management has always been lacking in communication.

pros: comparable compensation, remote work, hard working employees
cons: poor leadership, little understanding of employee experience, poor communication, dictatorial/top down approach to all operations, secretive and manipulative decision-making, top-level leadership takes no input from any other levels of organization to inform decision-making

job_title: Care Manager in Eau Claire, WI
pros:
Love the office environment. 
Managers are awesome
Value family life
cons:

pros: love the flexibility in this role
cons: too much work for one person in this role currently

job_title: Regional Program Manager in Wauwatosa, WI
pros: Lots of opportunity to learn and grow. There’s not so much oversight from management that you feel like there’s someone breathing down your neck. The mission is geared towards providing care in the best way possible. I don’t have any complaints.
cons: As mentioned, I don’t have any complaints.

pros: Work life balance and support from management WAS amazing
cons: Merged with a different MCO 1/2020 and no longer feel valued or supported

job_title: Care Manager in West Bend, WI
pros: Compensation, benefits, supportive coworkers and supervisors, rewarding work.
cons: Increasing responsibilities, stressful job, unclear communication

pros: Staff are empowered to provide the best care for all members.

review_title: Severe lack of communication and respect
pros: There are no pros to working here

pros: Care Wisconsin has an extremely welcoming atmosphere, and staff are always willing to help out. They are organized and have responsible, hard working employees that I’ve had the pleasure of working with this far! It is extremely rewarding to help the members that you work with, and for them to show appreciation and gratitude for your help.
cons: It’s a fast paced job and you definitely do a lot of learning as you go. You can’t take things personally, and you can’t slack, otherwise it will be a very difficult job.

cons: Literally everything else is a con
